alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 4:12PM EDT until April 11 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Greenwood and Saluda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 15.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1215 AM EDT.
